page.title: 09Newtown Gala Week
page.content: Newtown Gala Week began as a Gala Day which was organised in 1979 as part of the local celebrations for the Queen's Silver Jubilee.The local Community Council were given a grant to start the Gala Day, and they det up a sub-committee for this purpose.Representatives from each club in the village joined the committee and they set about organising a Gala that would cater for all.They did this with such success that the original day soon became a full week. The events include the talent contest, a country and western musical evening,a Mr. and Mrs. Quiz Show,a bowling contest, pet show, football match, darts competition,Car Treasure Hunt,It's a Knockout, BMX Bike Races,Eildon Hill Race, barbecue, fancy dress parade,Teddy Bear's Picnic,Bingo and dances and discos.
